image.altText: a computer screen with an 18+ over the top

props.synopsis: Age verification technology could be used to restrict children's access to online porn, certain games and even social media, but will "tech savvy" kids find a way around it? And what does it mean for the rest of the population?

title.children: Mum should have 'thrown my computer out the window', says porn addict, but warns age verification won’t work

image.altText: A red and blue train on tracks in Adelaide

props.synopsis: South Australian police are investigating after four women were randomly assaulted by a man unknown to them.

title.children: Four women allegedly 'punched, slapped, pushed, spat at and verbally abused' on Sunday morning train ride

image.altText: A parachute in the blue sky.

props.synopsis: Six members of a Sydney-based army unit that prepares parachutes for military exercises tested positive to illicit drugs just days before special forces soldier Jack Fitzgibbon was killed in a training jump.

title.children: Members of army unit that prepares parachutes tested positive for drugs days before fatal jump

image.altText: Image of a man in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Joe McDowell, an Australian man who was injured in a deadly shooting in central Afghanistan, is now in a stable condition in hospital.

title.children: Australian injured in Afghanistan shooting in stable condition in hospital

image.altText: A portrait photo of Nicole Zuritta.

props.synopsis: Nicole Zuritta's friend was murdered in one of Australia's most notorious serial killings, turning her world upside down. Almost three decades on, she wants to reframe the way victims of the Snowtown murders are remembered.

title.children: It looked like a run-of-the-mill robbery, but what Nicole found at home were traces of the Snowtown serial killings

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at a press conference with his mouth closed.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the opposition's proposals would leave about $40 billion worth of spending unanswered, though those claims appear to include restoring tax cuts for wealthy Australians, which the Coalition is yet to commit to.

title.children: Treasurer claims opposition's budget response would punch multi-billion-dollar hole in budget

image.altText: A young woman wearing black singlet top smiles while sitting at an outdoor table

props.synopsis: We asked Australians for their thoughts on cost-of-living measures unveiled in the federal budget. Among thousands of submissions, there's an overwhelming sense of despair.

title.children: What struggling Australians think about the 'cost-of-living' budget

image.altText: A huge cylindrical structure with US-style stars and stripes painted on one end is seen at an ourdoor facility, with people.

props.synopsis: South Australia's naval shipbuilding sector is moving to become more heavily involved in US nuclear submarine construction, well before work begins on AUKUS vessels.

title.children: SA makes play to enter US nuclear submarine supply chain ahead of AUKUS

image.altText: The scene of a crash between a ute and a truck.

props.synopsis: The victims — a woman and a man both aged in their 60s — were on a South Australian regional road when their ute was involved in a crash with a truck.

title.children: Horrific truck crash claims lives of two in ute in regional SA

image.altText: A mother in white shirt with brown long hair kisses her baby on his head as she holds him

props.synopsis: Regional families with sick children say they are at breaking point as they struggle with lengthy wait times for specialist medical appointments and mounting travel costs.

title.children: Baby Chace is hospitalised regularly due to a recurring illness but has to wait months to see a specialist

image.altText: A for lease sign at a picket fence

props.synopsis: Australia's rental vacancy rate hit a record low recently. But what is the vacancy rate actually signifying? And could an unoccupied home tax help to solve our housing crisis?

title.children: What's the link between low rental vacancy rates, housing crises, and unoccupied home taxes?

image.altText: A composite image of three women, all with neutral expressions, looking at the camera

props.synopsis: It's supposed to be the world's "most gender-equal" country, but behind that title, a devastating problem remains in Iceland.

title.children: Why gender-based and sexual violence is so high in the world's 'most gender-equal' country

image.altText: Composite of a balding man with a moustache in a suit and tie and a missing persons poster showing a teenage girl

props.synopsis: Cynthia Kinney was just 16 years old when she vanished from a laundromat in 1976. Decades later, her name is among multiple new words found in a word puzzle created by the notorious BTK serial killer, Dennis Rader.

title.children: 'Always wanted to kidnap a girl from a laundromat': How a killer's puzzle could solve a decades-old mystery

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Think you could beat a Hard Quiz contestant? Prove it. Let's play, HARD!

title.children: Want a slice of trivia victory with your morning news? Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: A man in blue shirt smiling.

props.synopsis: The Israel Defence Forces says that troops have retrieved the body of hostage Ron Benjamin from the war-torn Gaza Strip after he was "murdered" during the October 7 Hamas attack.

title.children: Body of Israeli hostage Ron Benjamin recovered from Gaza, says IDF

image.altText: Colour photo of Kerstin Pilz sitting on a wall in the embrace of a man with short brown hair. Both wear bright puffer jackets.

props.synopsis: Kerstin Pilz's life was turned upside down when she uncovered her dying husband's double life. She realised she had two choices: leave in anger, or find forgiveness and stay.

title.children: What happened when Kerstin discovered her husband's double life

image.altText: Golfer Scottie Scheffler, crouching near a fence where his ball is, talking to an official, as fans gather to watch

props.synopsis: World number one Scheffler, who began the day at Valhalla three shots off the lead, fell back with a two-over-par 73 that left him eight shots adrift.

title.children: Scottie Scheffler drops shots day after arrest, Lowry equals major championship record

image.altText: Marissa Williamson-Pohlman, wearing a black top and shorts, sitting on the edge of the ring, leaning back on the ropes

props.synopsis: From on the brink of homelessness to booking a ticket to the Paris Olympics, Marissa Williamson-Pohlman has had to fight tooth and nail for everything she has, both in and out of the ring.

title.children: 'I'm gonna be homeless': How an Aussie boxer rose from the depths of despair to booking a ticket to the Olympics

image.altText: Two heavyweight boxers in action, one landing a left hook while the other reacts in pain.

props.synopsis: Oleksandr Usyk has become the undisputed world heavyweight champion after one of the great title fights in modern boxing.

title.children: Oleksandr Usyk defeats Tyson Fury to become undisputed heavyweight champion

image.altText: An elderly couple floating in a pool holding blue and white foam dumbbells' smile lovingly at each other.

props.synopsis: At 6 feet 2 inches tall, Brett Rogers towers over the women in his aqua aerobics class but says he doesn't feel like a fish out of water because it's the best way to keep fit in retirement.

title.children: Brett is the only bloke in his aqua aerobics class and says more men should give it a go

image.altText: A boy fits a lid to a cup of lemonade at a lemonade stand.

props.synopsis: When six-year-old Charlie watched a Bluey episode where the pup made a lemonade stand, it motivated him to start saving. An expert says the vital money skills he's learning will help him throughout life.

title.children: Charlie is selling lemonade to save up for a boat, and the skills he's learning could help set him up for life

image.altText: Images from Virgin free cruise promotion Instagram reel.

props.synopsis: Virgin staff dancing at the boarding gate, a call from Richard Branson announcing they'd all won a free cruise, passengers wearing hats and filmed celebrating — but this winner says due to a change in itinerary, to claim her prize will cost her thousands.

title.children: Virgin passengers were told they'd won a free cruise, but some can't redeem the prize

image.altText: The skeletons of a dolphin and a whale sitting in a museum.

props.synopsis: The former head of the SA Museum's whale research team says the collection of specimens and the performing of necropsies have ceased due to a lack of funding and staff.

title.children: Concerns for future of marine research in SA aired as whale-watching season begins

image.altText: Black and grey striped kitten looks up at the camera from behind a white surface

props.synopsis: Broader adoption of keeping cats safe at home would have large benefits for cat welfare, human health, local wildlife and even the economy. So, should cat owners be required to keep their pets contained to their property?

title.children: Keeping pet cats indoors would save millions of native animals and billions of dollars. So what's stopping us?

image.altText: Sarah stands in front of a small pond

props.synopsis: What do you do when the traditional turf lawn isn't quite cutting it anymore? Rip it out and start again — this time with something other than lush green lines in mind.

title.children: Sarah killed her front lawn. She's never been happier or more relaxed

image.altText: Fork lightening cracks through a grey sky over a red rocky, treed cliff face.

props.synopsis: For those not ready to quit their day job and become full-time aurora hunters, landscape photographers suggest some natural phenomena that are a little easier to chase down with your camera.

title.children: Seven natural wonders to inspire your next trip

image.altText: Macarthur FC player Kearyn Baccus talks to the camera as part of the government's GambleAware NSW campaign

props.synopsis: Macarthur FC midfielder Kearyn Baccus, along with captain Ulises Dávila and Clayton Lewis, were arrested and charged on Friday following an investigation into alleged yellow card manipulation.

title.children: 'Responsible gambling' ad featuring A-League player charged over alleged betting corruption pulled down

image.altText: Man in hospital receiving care

props.synopsis: A visit to a much loved beach represents a major milestone for Devarshi Deka, as he — and his loved ones — come to grips with his life now, in the wake of the alleged attack which took so much away from him.

title.children: Beach milestone for Indian student left with disabilities after alleged attack in Hobart

image.altText: A young man with curly hair stands side on the camera with a river flowing behind him

props.synopsis: Lucas Venner entered his 20s with a common ambition: to travel the world. He has succeeded by hitchhiking the entire way. The Frenchman left his home country in early 2023 to embark on a 15-month mission to New Zealand — and the generosity of strangers has kept him going.

title.children: French hitchhiker has travelled 50,000km across the world in the passenger seats of strangers' cars

image.altText: A youth orchestra rehearsal

props.synopsis: A string of professional musicians have emerged from the ranks of the Bundaberg Youth Orchestra, which is one of the longest-running outfits of its kind.

title.children: Farming city famous for agriculture also growing world-class musicians

image.altText: Anthony Albanse poses for a selfie with high school students

props.synopsis: Fewer than two out of five voters under 40 voted for Labor at the last election. What does this year's budget say about the party's chances of hanging on to this vital demographic?

title.children: Younger voters say the budget does nothing to fix generational inequality

image.altText: An EH216-S flies over a city.

props.synopsis: China could soon become the first country in the world with flying taxis as part of Beijing's plan to develop what it calls the "low-altitude economy".

title.children: Flying taxis set to take off in China as part of push for 'low-altitude economy'

image.altText: Almonds being processed on the conveyer belt.

props.synopsis: Catering to the food needs of India's younger generation is a bountiful business, experts say, with India's average population sitting at 29 years old. And they would rather eat healthy food, providing opportunities for Australian producers.

title.children: How Australia is providing a key ingredient to India's culture

image.altText: Young cattle grazier holding remote control with drone hovering in background

props.synopsis: Cattle on a property in the outback are mustered by drones while the pilot sits far away on the Gold Coast during a world-first demonstration for graziers.

title.children: Horses, motorbikes and helicopters could be a thing of the past for mustering livestock

image.altText: A woman with red hair poses for a photo while sitting in a wheelchair with a desk behind her in a room in a house.

props.synopsis: Karin Swift's doctor refused to give her a cervical cancer screening on the grounds people with a disability are not "sexually active". She's now part of a campaign designed to help educate health professionals about how to treat people with a disability.

title.children: Karin dumped her doctor after they assumed she wouldn’t be 'sexually active'. Here's why that matters
